<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-Cristiano_Ronaldo skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">

		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Cristiano Ronaldo</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:About&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:About (page does not exist)">Template:About</a>
</p>
<div class="dablink">"CR7" redirects here. For other uses, see <a href="/w/index.php?title=CR7_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="CR7 (disambiguation) (page does not exist)">CR7 (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_dmy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use dmy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use dmy dates</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-semi-blp&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-semi-blp (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-semi-blp</a><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-move-indef&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-move-indef (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-move-indef</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Portuguese_name&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Portuguese name (page does not exist)">Template:Portuguese name</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Infobox_football_biography&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Infobox football biography (page does not exist)">Template:Infobox football biography</a>
<b>Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro</b>,<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">[1]</a></sup> <small><a href="/w/index.php?title=Order_of_Prince_Henry&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Order of Prince Henry (page does not exist)">OIH</a></small> (born 5 February 1985),<sup id="cite_ref-AtFeet_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtFeet-2">[2]</a></sup> known as <b>Cristiano Ronaldo</b>, is a Portuguese <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> for Spanish club <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> and <a href="/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captains</a> the <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal national team</a>. He became the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Transfer_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Transfer (association football) (page does not exist)">most expensive footballer in history</a> when he moved from <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> to Real Madrid in 2009 in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Transfer_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Transfer (association football) (page does not exist)">transfer</a> worth £80&#160;million (€94&#160;million/$131.6&#160;million). Ronaldo's contract with Real Madrid, under the terms of which he is paid €21&#160;million per year (after taxes), makes him the highest-paid footballer in the world,<sup id="cite_ref-goal.com_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-goal.com-3">[3]</a></sup> and his buyout clause is valued at €1&#160;billion as per his contract.<sup id="cite_ref-inside-buyout_4-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-inside-buyout-4">[4]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo began his career as a youth player for <a href="/w/index.php?title=CF_Andorinha&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="CF Andorinha (page does not exist)">Andorinha</a>, where he played for two years, before moving to <a href="/wiki/C.D._Nacional" title="C.D. Nacional">C.D. Nacional</a>. In 1997, he made a move to Portuguese giants <a href="/wiki/Sporting_Clube_de_Portugal" title="Sporting Clube de Portugal">Sporting Clube de Portugal</a>. Ronaldo caught the attention of <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> manager <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a>, who signed him for £12.24&#160;million (€15&#160;million) in 2003. In 2004, Ronaldo won his first club honour, the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a>.
</p><p>Ronaldo was the first player playing in England to win all four main PFA and FWA awards, doing so in 2007. In 2008 and 2013, Ronaldo won the <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">FIFA</a>/<a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or_(1956%E2%80%932009)" title="Ballon d'Or (1956–2009)">Ballon d'Or</a> award for the best footballer on the planet, being the first ever Portuguese to win the award twice.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup> He was awarded the <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a> in both 2008 and 2011. In 2008, he won three of the four main PFA and FWA trophies and was named the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFPro&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFPro (page does not exist)">FIFPro Player of the Year</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=World_Soccer_(magazine)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="World Soccer (magazine) (page does not exist)">World Soccer Player of the Year</a>, and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Onze_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Onze d'Or (page does not exist)">Onze d'Or</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">[7]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup> In 2007 and 2008, Ronaldo was named <a href="/wiki/FWA_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="FWA Footballer of the Year">FWA Footballer of the Year</a>. Ronaldo was the inaugural winner of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFA Puskás Award (page does not exist)">FIFA Puskás Award</a> for the Goal of the Year in 2009.
</p><p>Ronaldo is the first top European league player to reach 40 goals in a single season in two consecutive years, fastest Real Madrid player to reach one hundred league goals, and the first player ever to score against every team in a single season in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-footballzz1_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-footballzz1-10">[10]</a></sup> He also holds the record for most goals scored in a season for Real Madrid. In January 2014, Ronaldo scored his 400th career goal.<sup id="cite_ref-400Goals_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400Goals-11">[11]</a></sup> After spending his first year at Madrid wearing the number 9 shirt, he began wearing the number 7 again following the departure of long-serving striker <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ra%C3%BAl_Gonz%C3%A1lez&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Raúl González (page does not exist)">Raúl</a>. Ronaldo had previously worn the number 7 shirt at Manchester United.
</p><p>Ronaldo is a Portuguese international and made his debut in August 2003. He has been <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_footballers_with_100_or_more_caps&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of footballers with 100 or more caps (page does not exist)">capped over 100 times</a> and is his country's <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team#Most_goals" title="Portugal national football team">joint-top goalscorer</a> of all time. With Portugal he has participated in five major tournaments; <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">UEFA Euro 2004</a>, the <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2008" title="UEFA Euro 2008">UEFA Euro 2008</a>, the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012" title="UEFA Euro 2012">UEFA Euro 2012</a>. He scored his first international goal in the opening game of Euro 2004 against <a href="/wiki/Greece_national_football_team" title="Greece national football team">Greece</a>, in addition to helping Portugal reach <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2004_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2004 Final (page does not exist)">the final</a>. He took over the captaincy of the side in July 2008 and went on to captain Portugal to the semi-finals at Euro 2012 and finished the competition as the joint top scorer.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life">Early life</span></h2>
<p>Ronaldo was born in <a href="/wiki/Santo_Ant%C3%B3nio_(Funchal)" title="Santo António (Funchal)">Santo António</a>, a neighbourhood of <a href="/wiki/Funchal" title="Funchal">Funchal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>, the youngest child of Maria Dolores dos Santos Aveiro, a cook, and José Dinis Aveiro, a municipal gardener.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">[12]</a></sup> His second <a href="/wiki/Given_name" title="Given name">given name</a> "Ronaldo" was chosen after then-<a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">U.S. president</a> <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Reagan" title="Ronald Reagan">Ronald Reagan</a>, who was his father's favourite actor. He has one older brother, Hugo, and two older sisters, Elma and Liliana Cátia.<sup id="cite_ref-AtFeet_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtFeet-2">[2]</a></sup> His great-grandmother Isabel da Piedade was from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cape_Verde&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cape Verde (page does not exist)">Cape Verde</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
The family was staunchly Catholic and lived in poverty. Ronaldo had no toys and shared a room with his brother and sisters.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">[14]</a></sup> Ronaldo was popular with other students at school, but he was expelled after he threw a chair at his teacher. Ronaldo later said of the incident: "He disrespected me."<sup id="cite_ref-nowmagazine1_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nowmagazine1-15">[15]</a></sup> At the age of 14, Ronaldo agreed with his mother to then focus entirely on football.<sup id="cite_ref-nowmagazine1_15-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nowmagazine1-15">[15]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_career">Club career</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_career">Early career</span></h3>
<p>At the age of eight, Ronaldo played for amateur team <a href="/w/index.php?title=CF_Andorinha&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="CF Andorinha (page does not exist)">Andorinha</a>, where his father was the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Equipment_manager&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Equipment manager (page does not exist)">kit man</a>. In 1995, Ronaldo signed with local club <a href="/wiki/C.D._Nacional" title="C.D. Nacional">Nacional</a>, and, after a title-winning campaign, he went on a three-day trial with <a href="/wiki/Sporting_Clube_de_Portugal" title="Sporting Clube de Portugal">Sporting CP</a>, who subsequently signed him for an undisclosed sum.<sup id="cite_ref-about.com_16-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-about.com-16">[16]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sporting_CP">Sporting CP</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo joined Sporting's other youth players who trained at the <a href="/wiki/Sporting_Clube_de_Portugal#Academia_Sporting.2FPuma" title="Sporting Clube de Portugal">Academia Sporting</a>, the club's football academy, in <a href="/w/index.php?title=Alcochete&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alcochete (page does not exist)">Alcochete</a>. He became the only player ever to play for Sporting's under-16, under-17, under-18, B-team, and the first team, all within one season.<sup id="cite_ref-titans_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-titans-17">[17]</a></sup> He scored two goals in his league debut on 7 October 2002, which Sporting CP won 3–0 against <a href="/wiki/Moreirense_F.C." title="Moreirense F.C.">Moreirense</a>, while featuring for Portugal in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2002_UEFA_European_Under-17_Football_Championship&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2002 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship (page does not exist)">2002 European Under-17 Championship</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-u17_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u17-18">[18]</a></sup>
</p><p>At the age of 15 Ronaldo was diagnosed with a <a href="/wiki/Tachycardia" title="Tachycardia">racing heart</a>, a condition that might have forced him to give up playing football. The Sporting staff were made aware of the condition and Ronaldo's mother gave her authorisation for him to go into hospital.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">[19]</a></sup> While there, he had an operation in which a laser was used to cauterise the area of his heart that was causing the problem. The surgery took place in the morning and Ronaldo was discharged from hospital by the end of the afternoon; he resumed training only a few days later.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
</p><p>In November 2002, Ronaldo was invited to <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>'s training ground, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Shenley_Training_Centre&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Shenley Training Centre (page does not exist)">London Colney</a> to meet manager <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ars%C3%A8ne_Wenger&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arsène Wenger (page does not exist)">Arsène Wenger</a> and his coaching staff.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">[21]</a></sup> Wenger, who was interested in signing the midfielder, had arranged to meet Ronaldo's representatives, Formation (who suggested the player originally to <a href="/wiki/G%C3%A9rard_Houllier" title="Gérard Houllier">Gérard Houllier</a>, then Liverpool's manager and <a href="/wiki/Joan_Laporta" title="Joan Laporta">Joan Laporta</a>, then Barcelona's president) in the subsequent months to discuss a transfer arrangement.<sup id="cite_ref-cr101_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cr101-22">[22]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23">[23]</a></sup> However he came to the attention of <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> manager <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a> in the summer of 2003, when Sporting defeated United 3–1 in the inauguration of the <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Jos%C3%A9_Alvalade" title="Estádio José Alvalade">Estádio José Alvalade</a> in Lisbon. Ronaldo's performance impressed the Manchester United players, who urged Ferguson to sign him.<sup id="cite_ref-crwc_24-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-crwc-24">[24]</a></sup>
</p><p>On April 2013, Ronaldo was honoured by Sporting as the club announced that the player had become their 100,000th member.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">[25]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Manchester_United">Manchester United</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2003.E2.80.932006">2003–2006</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg" title="File:Ronaldo - Manchester United vs Chelsea.jpg">File:Ronaldo - Manchester United vs Chelsea.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo playing against <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a> in April 2006.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo became <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a>'s first-ever Portuguese player when he signed for €15&#160;million<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">[26]</a></sup> (£12.24&#160;million) after the <a href="/wiki/2002%E2%80%9303_FA_Premier_League" title="2002–03 FA Premier League">2002–03 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">[27]</a></sup> He requested the number 28 (his number at Sporting), as he did not want the pressure of living up to the expectation linked to the number 7 shirt, which had previously been worn by players such as <a href="/wiki/Johnny_Berry" title="Johnny Berry">Johnny Berry</a>, <a href="/wiki/George_Best" title="George Best">George Best</a>, <a href="/wiki/Steve_Coppell" title="Steve Coppell">Steve Coppell</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bryan_Robson" title="Bryan Robson">Bryan Robson</a>, <a href="/wiki/Eric_Cantona" title="Eric Cantona">Eric Cantona</a> and <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a>, and subsequently worn by <a href="/wiki/Michael_Owen" title="Michael Owen">Michael Owen</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Antonio_Valencia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Antonio Valencia (page does not exist)">Antonio Valencia</a>. "After I joined, the manager asked me what number I'd like. I said 28. But Ferguson said 'No, you're going to have No. 7,' and the famous shirt was an extra source of motivation. I was forced to live up to such an honour."<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">[28]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo made his team debut as a 60th-minute substitute in a 4–0 home victory over <a href="/wiki/Bolton_Wanderers_F.C." title="Bolton Wanderers F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a>. He scored his first goal for Manchester United with a free kick in a 3–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a> on 1 November 2003. Ronaldo ended his first season in English football by scoring the opening goal in United's 3–0 <a href="/w/index.php?title=2004_FA_Cup_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2004 FA Cup Final (page does not exist)">FA Cup final</a> victory over <a href="/wiki/Millwall_F.C." title="Millwall F.C.">Millwall</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
</p><p>He scored United's 1000th Premier League goal on 29 October 2005 in a 4–1 loss to <a href="/wiki/Middlesbrough_F.C." title="Middlesbrough F.C.">Middlesbrough</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">[30]</a></sup> He scored ten goals in all competitions, and fans voted him to his first <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFPro_Special_Young_Player_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFPro Special Young Player of the Year (page does not exist)">FIFPro Special Young Player of the Year</a> award in 2005.
</p><p>He was sent off in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Manchester_derby&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Manchester derby (page does not exist)">Manchester derby</a> at the <a href="/wiki/City_of_Manchester_Stadium" title="City of Manchester Stadium">City of Manchester Stadium</a> on 14 January 2006 (a game which United lost 3–1) for kicking City's former United player <a href="/wiki/Andrew_Cole" title="Andrew Cole">Andrew Cole</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">[31]</a></sup> Ronaldo won his second trophy in English football in the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_in_English_football" title="2005–06 in English football">2005–06 season</a>, scoring the third goal in Manchester United's 4–0 <a href="/wiki/Football_League_Cup" title="Football League Cup">Football League Cup</a> final victory over <a href="/wiki/Wigan_Athletic_F.C." title="Wigan Athletic F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">[32]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2006.E2.80.932009">2006–2009</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo with United during their 2006–07 season.</div></div></div>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_in_English_football" title="2006–07 in English football">2006–2007 season</a> proved to be the breakout year for Ronaldo, as he broke the 20 goal barrier for the first time and picked up his first <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_English_football_champions&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of English football champions (page does not exist)">league title</a> with Manchester United. An important factor in this success was his one-to-one training by first team coach <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ren%C3%A9_Meulensteen&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="René Meulensteen (page does not exist)">René Meulensteen</a>. Meulensteen coached him in moves to make himself more unpredictable. He also helped him to work better with his team-mates, calling for the ball and scoring more 'ugly' goals instead of waiting for the special occasion when he could score the 'beautiful' goals for which he was already famous.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">[33]</a></sup>
</p><p>In November and December 2006, Ronaldo received consecutive <a href="/w/index.php?title=FA_Premier_League_Player_of_the_Month&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FA Premier League Player of the Month (page does not exist)">Barclays Player of the Month</a> honours, becoming only the third player in Premier League history to do so after <a href="/wiki/Dennis_Bergkamp" title="Dennis Bergkamp">Dennis Bergkamp</a> in 1997 and <a href="/wiki/Robbie_Fowler" title="Robbie Fowler">Robbie Fowler</a> in 1996.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">[34]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">[35]</a></sup> He scored his 50th Manchester United goal against city rivals <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a> on 5 May 2007 as United claimed their first Premier League title in four years, and he was voted into his second consecutive FIFPro Special Young Player of the Year award at the end of the year.
</p><p>Despite rumours circulating in March 2007 that <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> were willing to pay an unprecedented €80&#160;million (£54&#160;million) for Ronaldo,<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">[36]</a></sup> he signed a five-year, £120,000-a-week (£31&#160;million total) extension with United on 13 April, making him the highest-paid player in team history.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">[37]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">[38]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo amassed a host of personal awards for the season. He won the <a href="/wiki/PFA_Players%27_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Players' Player of the Year">PFA Players' Player of the Year</a> and <a href="/wiki/PFA_Young_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Young Player of the Year">PFA Young Player of the Year</a> awards, joining <a href="/w/index.php?title=Andy_Gray_(commentator)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Andy Gray (commentator) (page does not exist)">Andy Gray</a> (in <a href="/w/index.php?title=1976%E2%80%9377_in_English_football&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="1976–77 in English football (page does not exist)">1977</a>) as the only players to receive this honour.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">[39]</a></sup> In April, he completed the treble by winning the <a href="/w/index.php?title=PFA_Fans%27_Player_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="PFA Fans' Player of the Year (page does not exist)">PFA Fans' Player of the Year</a>. He also won the <a href="/wiki/FWA_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="FWA Footballer of the Year">FWA Footballer of the Year</a>, becoming the first player to win all four main <a href="/wiki/Professional_Footballers%27_Association" title="Professional Footballers' Association">PFA</a> and <a href="/wiki/Football_Writers%27_Association" title="Football Writers' Association">FWA</a> awards. Ronaldo was also one of eight Manchester United players named in the 2006–07 <a href="/w/index.php?title=PFA_Team_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="PFA Team of the Year (page does not exist)">PFA Premier League Team of the Year</a>.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ronaldo_Tevez.jpg" title="File:Ronaldo Tevez.jpg">File:Ronaldo Tevez.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo (left) and <a href="/wiki/Carlos_T%C3%A9vez" title="Carlos Tévez">Carlos Tévez</a> prior to a Champions League match.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo's <a href="/w/index.php?title=2007%E2%80%9308_Premier_League&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2007–08 Premier League (page does not exist)">2007–08</a> season began with a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Penalty_card&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Penalty card (page does not exist)">red card</a> for a headbutt on <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a> player <a href="/wiki/Richard_Hughes_(footballer)" title="Richard Hughes (footballer)">Richard Hughes</a> during United's second match of the season, for which he was punished with a three-match ban.<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">[40]</a></sup> Ronaldo said he had "learned a lot" from the experience and would not let players "provoke" him in the future.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">[41]</a></sup> After scoring the only goal in a Champions League away match against Sporting, Ronaldo also scored the injury-time winner in the return fixture as Manchester United topped their Champions League group.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">[42]</a></sup>
</p><p>He finished as the runner-up to <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> for the 2007 <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">Ballon d'Or</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">[43]</a></sup> and was third in the running for the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award, behind Kaká and <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">[44]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored his first <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hat-trick_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hat-trick (association football) (page does not exist)">hat-trick</a> for Manchester United in a 6–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Newcastle_United_F.C." title="Newcastle United F.C.">Newcastle United</a> at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a> on 12 January 2008, bringing Manchester United up to the top of the Premier League table.<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-45">[45]</a></sup> He scored his twenty-third league goal of the season in a 2–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Reading_F.C." title="Reading F.C.">Reading</a>, equalling his entire total for the 2006–07 season.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">[46]</a></sup> During a 1–1 Champions League first knockout round draw against <a href="/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Olympique Lyonnais">Lyon</a> on 20 February, an unidentified Lyon supporter continuously aimed a green laser at Ronaldo and United teammate <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nani (page does not exist)">Nani</a>, prompting an investigation by UEFA.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">[47]</a></sup> One month later, Lyon were fined <a href="/wiki/Swiss_franc" title="Swiss franc">CHF</a>5,000 (£2,427) for the incident.<sup id="cite_ref-reuters_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reuters-48">[48]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 19 March 2008, Ronaldo captained United for the first time in his career in a home win over Bolton, scoring both goals in the 2–0 victory.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">[49]</a></sup> The second of the goals was his 33rd of the campaign, which set a new club single-season scoring record by a midfielder and thus topped George Best's forty-year-old total of 32 goals in the 1967–68 season.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">[50]</a></sup> Ronaldo scored another brace in a 4–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Aston_Villa_F.C." title="Aston Villa F.C.">Aston Villa</a> on 29 March, which at the time gave him 35 goals in 37 domestic and European matches as both a starter and substitute. Ronaldo's scoring streak was rewarded with his becoming the first winger to win the 2007–08 <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a>, finishing eight points ahead of <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a>'s <a href="/w/index.php?title=Dani_G%C3%BCiza&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dani Güiza (page does not exist)">Dani Güiza</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">[51]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em; width: 25%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>Ronaldo is better than <a href="/wiki/George_Best" title="George Best">George Best</a> and <a href="/wiki/Denis_Law" title="Denis Law">Denis Law</a>, who were two brilliant and great players in the history of United.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— Three-time <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">Ballon d'Or</a> winner <a href="/w/index.php?title=Johan_Cruyff&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Johan Cruyff (page does not exist)">Johan Cruyff</a> on the 23-year-old Ronaldo, April 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-presstv1_52-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-presstv1-52">[52]</a></sup></div>
</div>
<p>In the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2008_UEFA_Champions_League_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2008 UEFA Champions League Final (page does not exist)">2007–08 Champions League final</a> on 21 May against league rivals <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a>, Ronaldo scored the opening goal after 26 minutes, which was negated by a Chelsea equaliser in the 45th minute as the match ended 1–1 after extra time. His misfire in the penalty shoot-out put Chelsea in position to win the trophy, but <a href="/wiki/John_Terry" title="John Terry">John Terry</a> shot wide right after slipping on the pitch surface, and Manchester United emerged victorious 6–5 on penalties. Ronaldo was named the UEFA Fans' Man of the Match,<sup id="cite_ref-uefaCL_53-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-uefaCL-53">[53]</a></sup> and wrapped up the campaign with a career-high 42 goals in all competitions, falling four short of <a href="/wiki/Denis_Law" title="Denis Law">Denis Law</a>'s team-record mark of 46 in the 1963–64 season. In the Champions League he was also named <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Champions_League_Best_Forward&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Champions League Best Forward (page does not exist)">best forward</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Club_Footballer_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Club Footballer of the Year (page does not exist)">player of the tournament</a> and was the <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_European_Cup_and_UEFA_Champions_League_top_scorers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League top scorers (page does not exist)">competition's top goalscorer</a>.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling_cropped.JPG" title="File:2009-3-14 ManUtd vs LFC Ronaldo Tackling cropped.JPG">File:2009-3-14 ManUtd vs LFC Ronaldo Tackling cropped.JPG</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo and Manchester United against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Albert_Riera&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Albert Riera (page does not exist)">Albert Riera</a> and rivals <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>On 5 June 2008, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sky_Sports&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sky Sports (page does not exist)">Sky Sports</a> reported that Ronaldo had expressed an interest in moving to Real Madrid if they offered him the same amount of money the team had allegedly promised him earlier in the year.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">[54]</a></sup> Manchester United filed a tampering complaint with <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> on 9 June over Madrid's alleged pursuit of Ronaldo, but FIFA declined to take any action.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">[55]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">[56]</a></sup> Speculation that a transfer would happen continued until 6 August, when Ronaldo confirmed that he would stay at United for at least another year.<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57">[57]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo underwent ankle surgery at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Academic_Medical_Center&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Academic Medical Center (page does not exist)">Academic Medical Center</a> in Amsterdam on 7 July.<sup id="cite_ref-bbcsport_58-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbcsport-58">[58]</a></sup> He returned to action on 17 September in United's goalless <a href="/w/index.php?title=2008%E2%80%9309_UEFA_Champions_League&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2008–09 UEFA Champions League (page does not exist)">UEFA Champions League</a> group stage draw with <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> as a substitute for <a href="/wiki/Park_Ji-Sung" title="Park Ji-Sung">Park Ji-Sung</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59">[59]</a></sup> and scored his first goal of the season in a 3–1 <a href="/wiki/Football_League_Cup" title="Football League Cup">League Cup</a> third round win over Middlesbrough on 24 September.
</p><p>In a 5–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Stoke_City_F.C." title="Stoke City F.C.">Stoke City</a> on 15 November 2008, Ronaldo scored his 100th and 101st goals in all competitions for Manchester United, both from free kicks.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60">[60]</a></sup> The goals also meant that Ronaldo had now scored against each of the other 19 teams in the Premier League at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">[61]</a></sup> On 2 December, Ronaldo became Manchester United's first <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or_2008&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ballon d'Or 2008 (page does not exist)">Ballon d'Or</a> recipient since <a href="/wiki/George_Best" title="George Best">George Best</a> in <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or_1968&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ballon d'Or 1968 (page does not exist)">1968</a>. He finished with 446 points, 165 ahead of runner-up <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-worldgame_62-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-worldgame-62">[62]</a></sup> He was awarded the Silver Ball after finishing with two goals as United won the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2008_FIFA_Club_World_Cup&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2008 FIFA Club World Cup (page does not exist)">Club World Cup</a> on 19 December.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63">[63]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 January 2009, Ronaldo was uninjured in a single-car accident in which he <a href="/w/index.php?title=Total_loss&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Total loss (page does not exist)">wrote off</a> his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ferrari_599_GTB_Fiorano&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano (page does not exist)">Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano</a> in a tunnel along the <a href="/w/index.php?title=A538_road&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="A538 road (page does not exist)">A538</a> near <a href="/wiki/Manchester_Airport" title="Manchester Airport">Manchester Airport</a>. A <a href="/wiki/Breathalyser" title="Breathalyser" class="mw-redirect">breathalyser</a> test he gave to police officers at the scene was negative, and he attended training later that morning.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">[64]</a></sup> Four days later, he became the first Premier League player ever to be named the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a>, in addition to being the first Portuguese player to win the award since <a href="/wiki/Lu%C3%ADs_Figo" title="Luís Figo">Luís Figo</a> in 2001.<sup id="cite_ref-wpoy_65-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wpoy-65">[65]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored his first Champions League goal of the season, and first since the final against Chelsea in a 2–0 victory over <a href="/w/index.php?title=F.C._Internazionale_Milano&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="F.C. Internazionale Milano (page does not exist)">Internazionale</a> that sent United into the quarter-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">[66]</a></sup> In the second leg against <a href="/wiki/F.C._Porto" title="F.C. Porto">Porto</a>, Ronaldo scored a 40-yard game-winning goal as United advanced to the semi-finals. For this goal Ronaldo holds the distinction of being the first player to win the <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFA Puskás Award (page does not exist)">FIFA Puskás Award</a>, in 2009, an honour handed by <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> to the best goal of the year.<sup id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-67">[67]</a></sup> He later called it the best goal he had ever scored.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">[68]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69">[69]</a></sup> Ronaldo participated in his second consecutive <a href="/w/index.php?title=2009_UEFA_Champions_League_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2009 UEFA Champions League Final (page does not exist)">Champions League final</a>, but made little impact in United's 2–0 loss to Barcelona. He finished with 53 appearances in all competitions, which was four higher than the previous year, but scored sixteen fewer goals (26) than his career-best total of 42 from the previous season.
</p><p>On 11 June, Manchester United accepted an unconditional offer of £80&#160;million from Real Madrid for Ronaldo after it was revealed that he again had expressed his desire to leave the club.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70">[70]</a></sup> It was confirmed by a representative of the Glazer family that the sale was fully condoned by Ferguson.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">[71]</a></sup> When Ronaldo had eventually completed his transfer to Real, he expressed his gratitude towards Ferguson for helping him develop as a player, saying, "He's been my father in sport, one of the most important factors and most influential in my career."<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">[72]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Real_Madrid">Real Madrid</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2009.E2.80.9310_season">2009–10 season</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em; width: 30%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>I have nothing but praise for the boy. He is easily the best player in the world. His contribution as a goal threat is unbelievable. His stats are incredible. Strikes at goal, attempts on goal, raids into the penalty box, headers. It is all there. Absolutely astounding.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a>, after Ronaldo's transfer to Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-bio_73-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bio-73">[73]</a></sup></div>
</div>
<p>On 26 June 2009, <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> confirmed that Ronaldo would join the club on 1 July 2009 from Manchester United for £80&#160;million (€94&#160;million) becoming <a href="/w/index.php?title=Transfer_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Transfer (association football) (page does not exist)">the most expensive footballer in history</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74">[74]</a></sup> after agreeing terms and signing a six-year contract.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">[75]</a></sup> Ronaldo's contract is worth €11&#160;million per year<sup id="cite_ref-bbc-agrees_76-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-agrees-76">[76]</a></sup> and it has a €1&#160;billion buy-out clause.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">[77]</a></sup> He was presented to the world media as a Real Madrid player on 6 July,<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">[78]</a></sup> where he was handed the number 9 jersey.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo_.279.27_79-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo_.279.27-79">[79]</a></sup> The shirt was presented to him by Madrid legend <a href="/wiki/Alfredo_Di_St%C3%A9fano" title="Alfredo Di Stéfano">Alfredo Di Stéfano</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80">[80]</a></sup> Ronaldo was welcomed by between 80,000 and 85,000 fans at his presentation at the <a href="/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu Stadium</a>, surpassing <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>'s record of 75,000 fans when he was presented in Italy, after he was transferred from <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> to <a href="/wiki/S.S.C._Napoli" title="S.S.C. Napoli">Napoli</a> in 1984.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">[81]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-82">[82]</a></sup> The event was broadcast live on the Spanish and Portuguese <a href="/wiki/Public_broadcasting" title="Public broadcasting">public TV stations</a>, <a href="/wiki/RTVE" title="RTVE">RTVE</a> and <a href="/wiki/R%C3%A1dio_e_Televis%C3%A3o_de_Portugal" title="Rádio e Televisão de Portugal">RTP</a> respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">[83]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">[84]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_y_Diego_Forl%C3%A1n.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo y Diego Forlán.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo y Diego Forlán.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo and Real Madrid against <a href="/wiki/Diego_Forl%C3%A1n" title="Diego Forlán">Diego Forlán</a> and city rivals <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo made his Madrid debut on 21 July in a 1–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Shamrock_Rovers_F.C." title="Shamrock Rovers F.C.">Shamrock Rovers</a>. His first goal came one week later with a penalty in Madrid's 4–2 win over <a href="/w/index.php?title=Liga_Deportiva_Universitaria_de_Quito&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Liga Deportiva Universitaria de Quito (page does not exist)">LDU Quito</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">[85]</a></sup> On 29 August, Ronaldo capped his <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> debut with a goal, scoring Real's second from the penalty spot in a 3–2 home win against <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_de_La_Coru%C3%B1a" title="Deportivo de La Coruña">Deportivo La Coruña</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">[86]</a></sup> On 15 September, Ronaldo scored two free-kicks in a 5–2 away victory over <a href="/wiki/FC_Z%C3%BCrich" title="FC Zürich">Zürich</a>, his first Champions League goals for Real.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87">[87]</a></sup> He broke a Madrid club record when he scored in a league match against <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> and thus became the first ever player to score in his first four La Liga appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">[88]</a></sup>
</p><p>An ankle injury suffered on 10 October, while Ronaldo was on international duty with <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> against <a href="/wiki/Hungary_national_football_team" title="Hungary national football team">Hungary</a>, kept him out until 25 November, which in turn caused him to miss both of Madrid's Champions League group stage matches against <a href="/w/index.php?title=A.C._Milan&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="A.C. Milan (page does not exist)">Milan</a>.{{ safesubst:#invoke:Unsubst||$N=Citation needed |date=__DATE__ |$B=
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Fix&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Fix (page does not exist)">Template:Fix</a>
}} Ronaldo made his first post-injury start in a 1–0 <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=El_Cl%C3%A1sico&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="El Clásico (page does not exist)">El Clásico</a></i> defeat to <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> on 29 November. On 6 December, he was sent off for the first time in his Madrid career during Real's 4–2 victory against <a href="/w/index.php?title=UD_Almer%C3%ADa&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UD Almería (page does not exist)">Almería</a>, a match which also saw him miss a penalty. He was carded first for removing his shirt during a goal celebration, then for kicking out at an opponent three minutes later.<sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">[89]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was second in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2009_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2009 FIFA World Player of the Year (page does not exist)">2009 FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award and also second in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or_2009&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ballon d'Or 2009 (page does not exist)">2009 Ballon d'Or</a> award. On 5 May 2010, Ronaldo scored his first Real Madrid hat-trick in an away game against <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a>. Ronaldo and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gonzalo_Higua%C3%ADn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gonzalo Higuaín (page does not exist)">Gonzalo Higuaín</a> scored 53 league goals during the course of the season and became Real's highest scoring league duo in their history.<sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-90">[90]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2010.E2.80.9311_season">2010–11 season</span></h4>
<p>With the departure of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ra%C3%BAl_Gonz%C3%A1lez&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Raúl González (page does not exist)">Raúl</a> during the summer of 2010, Ronaldo was handed the number 7 jersey for Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">[91]</a></sup> On 23 October 2010, Ronaldo scored four goals against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Racing_de_Santander&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Racing de Santander (page does not exist)">Racing de Santander</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">[92]</a></sup> the most goals he has ever scored in a single match.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">[93]</a></sup> This completed a goalscoring run of six consecutive matches (three in La Liga, one in the Champions League, and two for <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a>) in which Ronaldo scored in each match, totalling 11 goals, which is the most Ronaldo has scored in a single month. Before Real Madrid's 5–0 defeat by Barcelona at the Camp Nou, Ronaldo scored his second La Liga hat-trick of the season in a 5–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">[94]</a></sup> His final match of the calendar year saw him score a hat-trick in a 8–0 trashing of <a href="/wiki/Levante_UD" title="Levante UD">Levante</a> in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2010%E2%80%9311_Copa_del_Rey&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2010–11 Copa del Rey (page does not exist)">Copa del Rey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">[95]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pato_Sosa_vs_Ronaldo.jpg" title="File:Pato Sosa vs Ronaldo.jpg">File:Pato Sosa vs Ronaldo.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo during a friendly game against <a href="/w/index.php?title=C.A._Pe%C3%B1arol&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="C.A. Peñarol (page does not exist)">Peñarol</a> before the beginning of the season.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo began 2011 with a very promising outlook, especially after Real Madrid acknowledged he had broken numerous goalscoring records, previously settled and held by classic players such as <a href="/wiki/Alfredo_Di_St%C3%A9fano" title="Alfredo Di Stéfano">Alfredo Di Stéfano</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hugo_S%C3%A1nchez" title="Hugo Sánchez">Hugo Sánchez</a>, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Manuel_Alday_Marticorena&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Manuel Alday Marticorena (page does not exist)">Manuel Alday</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">[96]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">[97]</a></sup> Ronaldo began his scoring spree by scoring two vital goals in a tight 3–2 victory away to <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">[98]</a></sup> He then consolidated his massive performances by scoring a hat-trick and assisting <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> to score his first league goal after his return from injury in a 4–2 victory over <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> on 9 January. On 3 March 2011, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick in a 7–0 trashing of <a href="/wiki/M%C3%A1laga_CF" title="Málaga CF">Málaga</a>, but was affected by a muscle injury at the end of the match, which forced him to spend 10 days on the sidelines.
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo Real Madrid Gareth Bale Tottenham.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo Real Madrid Gareth Bale Tottenham.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo against <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham</a>'s (and future team-mate) <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gareth_Bale&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gareth Bale (page does not exist)">Gareth Bale</a> in the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>In April, he made another massive comeback from injury, sustaining a three-game scoring streak (including two goals in <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> quarter-finals against <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>), thus arriving to the first of a historical series of four <a href="/w/index.php?title=El_Cl%C3%A1sico&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="El Clásico (page does not exist)">El Clásico</a> encounters two goals short of breaking his personal record of 42 goals in all competitions in a single season, achieved at <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in the 2007–08 season.
</p><p>During the second league edition of El Clásico, Ronaldo scored from the penalty spot and took his tally to 41 goals, also taking his scoring streak to four games. On 20 April, Ronaldo scored the winning goal against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in the 103rd minute of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_Copa_del_Rey_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 Copa del Rey Final (page does not exist)">Copa del Rey final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">[99]</a></sup> This goal would later be chosen as both Ronaldo's and Real Madrid's best goal in the season by several fan polls, including those of <i>Marca</i><sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">[100]</a></sup> and Real Madrid's website.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">[101]</a></sup> 7 May saw Real travel to the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Estadio_Ram%C3%B3n_S%C3%A1nchez_Pizju%C3%A1n&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Estadio Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán (page does not exist)">Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán</a> to take on Sevilla, where Ronaldo led the thrashing of the Andalusian side, scoring four goals in a 6–2 victory. These four goals took him to 46 for the season which surpassed his previous record of 42 in a season playing for Manchester United.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">[102]</a></sup> Three days later he reached 49 goals for the season, by scoring another hat-trick in a 4–0 home win against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a>. On 15 May, after scoring two free-kick goals in a 3–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a>, he equalled the <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> record with most goals in a season with 38, a record previously held by <a href="/wiki/Telmo_Zarra" title="Telmo Zarra">Telmo Zarra</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hugo_S%C3%A1nchez" title="Hugo Sánchez">Hugo Sánchez</a>.
</p><p>On 21 May, he scored two goals in the last league match of the season against Almería, taking his Pichichi total to 41, and La Liga total to 40, becoming the only player to score 40 goals in a La Liga season. By doing this, he won the <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a> award once again, becoming the first player to win the trophy in two different leagues. The sports newspaper <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Marca_(newspaper)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Marca (newspaper) (page does not exist)">Marca</a></i>, which awards the <a href="/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi Trophy</a>, included the goal scored on 18 September 2010 against Real Sociedad in Ronaldo's goal count, which had been officially attributed to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pepe_(footballer_born_1983)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pepe (footballer born 1983) (page does not exist)">Pepe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-pepegoal_103-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pepegoal-103">[103]</a></sup> Should this goal be granted to Ronaldo, his goal count in the Pichichi Trophy would tally 41 goals. Ronaldo also broke Zarra's record of most goals per minute, with a goal scored every 70.7 minutes. However, regardless of this goal polemic, Ronaldo's record-breaking figures became a source of major attention from public media, such as being included in the <i><a href="/wiki/Sports_Illustrated" title="Sports Illustrated">Sports Illustrated</a></i> World XI,<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">[104]</a></sup> rating him as one of the world's best footballers.
</p><p>Ronaldo ended his second season at Real Madrid by winning his first club honour with the club, the 2011 Copa del Rey, notching a total of 53 goals (not granting him the controversial goal from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pepe_(footballer_born_1983)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pepe (footballer born 1983) (page does not exist)">Pepe</a>) in all competitions, having scored 25 goals with his right foot (excluding free-kicks and penalty-kicks) and 9 with his left foot.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">[105]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2011.E2.80.9312_season">2011–12 season</span></h4>
<p>Real Madrid's pre-season began with a 4–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/Major_League_Soccer" title="Major League Soccer">MLS</a> team <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_Galaxy" title="Los Angeles Galaxy">Los Angeles Galaxy</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">[106]</a></sup> with goals from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jos%C3%A9_Callej%C3%B3n&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="José Callejón (page does not exist)">José Callejón</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Joselu&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Joselu (page does not exist)">Joselu</a>, Ronaldo and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Karim_Benzema&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Karim Benzema (page does not exist)">Karim Benzema</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">[107]</a></sup> Four days later Ronaldo scored a second half hat-trick in a 3–0 win against <a href="/w/index.php?title=C.D._Guadalajara&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="C.D. Guadalajara (page does not exist)">Guadalajara</a>. Ronaldo's preseason performance was highly praised as world media kept hailing Ronaldo's extreme competitiveness and motivation, even during friendly matches. On 17 August 2011, Ronaldo scored his 100th goal with Real Madrid with a first-half equaliser against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in the second leg of the 2011 <a href="/wiki/Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="Supercopa de España">Spanish Supercup</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>. On 27 August 2011, he opened the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_La_Liga&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 La Liga (page does not exist)">2011–12 La Liga</a> season with a hat-trick in a 6–0 win at <a href="/wiki/Real_Zaragoza" title="Real Zaragoza">Real Zaragoza</a>.
</p><p>In the first weeks of September, Ronaldo's physical performance was subject to scrutiny by world media, after <a href="/wiki/Castrol" title="Castrol">Castrol</a> released a television film named <i>Ronaldo: Tested to the Limit</i> where he was put to test in several fields, including mental and physical. Conclusions from the movie and doctors in the weeks following claimed that Ronaldo was one of the best athletes in the world, excelling in football and outstanding in almost every other category.{{ safesubst:#invoke:Unsubst||$N=Citation needed |date=__DATE__ |$B=
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Fix&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Fix (page does not exist)">Template:Fix</a>
}} On 24 September, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick (including two penalties) in Real Madrid's 6–2 win over <a href="/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a> at the Santiago Bernabéu. This was his ninth <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> hat-trick and tenth hat-trick for Real Madrid.
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ajax.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ajax.jpg">File:Cristiano Ajax.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo against <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> during their <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 UEFA Champions League group stage (page does not exist)">group stage match</a> in the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> on 27 September 2011.</div></div></div>
<p>On 27 September, Ronaldo scored Real's opening goal in a 3–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Estadio_Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u" title="Estadio Santiago Bernabéu" class="mw-redirect">Santiago Bernabéu</a> in the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a>. On 22 October, after not scoring in his previous three games, Ronaldo scored his tenth La Liga hat-trick and eleventh in total for Real Madrid in a match away to <a href="/wiki/M%C3%A1laga_CF" title="Málaga CF">Málaga</a>, which Real Madrid won 4–0. His twelfth Real Madrid hat-trick followed on 6 November in a 7–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/CA_Osasuna" title="CA Osasuna">Osasuna</a> that ensured Madrid stayed top of the table heading into the international break.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">[108]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 19 November 2011, Ronaldo scored Real's second goal in a 2–3 defeat of <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a>. On 26 November 2011, Ronaldo scored two penalties in a 4–1 defeat of <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=El_Derbi_madrile%C3%B1o&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="El Derbi madrileño (page does not exist)">El Derbi madrileño</a>. On 3 December 2011, Ronaldo scored Madrid's second goal in a 0–3 defeat of <a href="/wiki/Sporting_de_Gij%C3%B3n" title="Sporting de Gijón">Sporting de Gijón</a> in <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_La_Liga&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 La Liga (page does not exist)">La Liga</a>. He was one of the three finalists for the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>. On 13 December 2011, Ronaldo scored the second goal against <a href="/w/index.php?title=SD_Ponferradina&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="SD Ponferradina (page does not exist)">SD Ponferradina</a> in the first leg of the <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> Round 4, the match ended in a 0–2 win. On 17 December 2011, Ronaldo scored his twelfth <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> hat-trick and thirteenth overall in a 6–2 win away to <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a>.
</p><p>Ronaldo was third in the 2010–11 <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Best_Player_in_Europe_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Best Player in Europe Award (page does not exist)">UEFA Best Player in Europe Award</a>, behind <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Xavi" title="Xavi">Xavi</a>, and second in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, behind Lionel Messi and ahead of Xavi. In Real Madrid's next game in La Liga at home to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Granada_CF&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Granada CF (page does not exist)">Granada</a> Ronaldo scored the fifth goal in a 5–1 win. On 22 January 2012, Ronaldo scored two penalties in a 4–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a>, and on 28 January scored Real Madrid's second and winning goal in a 3–1 win against <a href="/wiki/Real_Zaragoza" title="Real Zaragoza">Zaragoza</a>. Ronaldo also scored two goals against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_Copa_del_Rey&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 Copa del Rey (page does not exist)">Copa del Rey</a> Quarter-finals, which Real lost 4–3 on aggregrate. On 12 February 2012, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick, his thirteenth in La Liga and fourteenth for Real Madrid in a 4–2 home win over Levante. This win stretched Real Madrid's lead over second-placed Barcelona to 10 points.
</p><p>On 24 March 2012, Ronaldo reached more than 100 goals in La Liga in just three seasons at Real Madrid when he scored the first of his two goals in the match against <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a>, the second quickest <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> player to reach that milestone in the league after <a href="/w/index.php?title=Isidro_L%C3%A1ngara&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Isidro Lángara (page does not exist)">Isidro Lángara</a>, reaching the milestone in 92 matches and breaking the previous club record held by Puskás.<sup id="cite_ref-autogeneratedcc_109-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-autogeneratedcc-109">[109]</a></sup> As of 24 March 2012, Ronaldo had averaged 1.01 goals per game in La Liga.
</p><p>On 11 April, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Atletico_Madrid" title="Atletico Madrid" class="mw-redirect">Atletico Madrid</a> in a 1–4 win, as well as assisting the last goal. His hat-trick, one goal from a free kick, one from 30 yards on the left wing and one penalty, gave him 40 league goals in the season, making him the only player in La Liga history, or in any other major European league, to score 40 goals in two seasons, even doing so in consecutive seasons. Ronaldo officially broke his previous record of 40 goals in a La Liga season on 14 April, scoring in a 3–1 win against <a href="/wiki/Sporting_de_Gij%C3%B3n" title="Sporting de Gijón">Sporting Gijón</a>. On 25 April, in the second leg of the semi-finals in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 UEFA Champions League knockout phase (page does not exist)">2011–12 UEFA Champions League</a> against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Bayern_Munich&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bayern Munich (page does not exist)">Bayern Munich</a>, Ronaldo converted a penalty from a <a href="/w/index.php?title=David_Alaba&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="David Alaba (page does not exist)">David Alaba</a> handball and scored a second goal from a pass from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Mesut_%C3%96zil&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesut Özil (page does not exist)">Mesut Özil</a>. Extra time ended with the tie level at 3–3, and Real Madrid were eliminated in the shootout with Ronaldo's kick being saved by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Manuel_Neuer&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Manuel Neuer (page does not exist)">Manuel Neuer</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">[110]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 13 May 2012, the last matchday, Ronaldo scored against <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a> which made him the first player ever to score against every team in a single season in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-footballzz1_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-footballzz1-10">[10]</a></sup> He ended his third season at Real Madrid by winning his first <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011%E2%80%9312_La_Liga&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011–12 La Liga (page does not exist)">league title</a> with the club, with a record 100 points, notching a total of 46 league goals and 60 goals in all competitions, breaking the Real Madrid record he had set the previous season. At the end of the season, Ronaldo claimed that he believed that he had played better than Lionel Messi in the 2011–12 season,<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">[111]</a></sup> and he went on to win the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Trofeo_Alfredo_Di_Stefano&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Trofeo Alfredo Di Stefano (page does not exist)">Trofeo Alfredo Di Stefano</a> as the La Liga player of the season.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2012.E2.80.9313_season">2012–13 season</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_vs_AC_Milan,_August_2012_at_Yankee_Stadium.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo vs AC Milan, August 2012 at Yankee Stadium.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo vs AC Milan, August 2012 at Yankee Stadium.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo during a friendly game against <a href="/w/index.php?title=A.C._Milan&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="A.C. Milan (page does not exist)">Milan</a> before the beginning of the season.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo started the season by lifting the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2012_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2012 Supercopa de España (page does not exist)">Supercopa de España</a> with Real Madrid, scoring two goals in a 4–4 away goals aggregate win against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a>. The goal in the first leg made him the first Madrid player in the history of <a href="/w/index.php?title=El_Cl%C3%A1sico&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="El Clásico (page does not exist)">El Clásico</a> to score for the fourth game in a row at the Camp Nou,<sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112">[112]</a></sup> with the winning goal in the second leg, Ronaldo equalled the Real Madrid record of <a href="/wiki/Iv%C3%A1n_Zamorano" title="Iván Zamorano">Iván Zamorano</a> of scoring in five consecutive El Clásico matches.<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113">[113]</a></sup> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Diario_AS&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Diario AS (page does not exist)">AS</a></i> reported that <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a> president <a href="/wiki/Mansour_bin_Zayed_Al_Nahyan" title="Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan">Sheikh Mansour</a> had made a bid of €200&#160;million for Ronaldo in the summer, but Real Madrid turned the bid down.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">[114]</a></sup> On 30 August, Ronaldo was second (tied with <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>) in the 2011–12 <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Best_Player_in_Europe_Award&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Best Player in Europe Award (page does not exist)">UEFA Best Player in Europe Award</a> with 17 votes, behind winner <a href="/w/index.php?title=Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Andrés Iniesta (page does not exist)">Iniesta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">[115]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 2 September 2012, Ronaldo scored his first league goal of the season in a 3–0 win over <a href="/w/index.php?title=Granada_CF&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Granada CF (page does not exist)">Granada</a>, which was also his 200th career goal in league matches played in <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">England</a>, <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">Spain</a> and <a href="/wiki/Primeira_Liga" title="Primeira Liga">Portugal</a>. He added another goal, which was his 150th goal for Real Madrid in all competitions in 149 matches played. This goal made him the 10th highest scorer for Real Madrid in all competitions. Ronaldo was substituted at the 63rd minute by team mate <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gonzalo_Higua%C3%ADn&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gonzalo Higuaín (page does not exist)">Higuaín</a>, due to a minor thigh injury.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">[116]</a></sup> Afterwards, Ronaldo claimed that he was unhappy with a "professional issue" after he refused to celebrate his 149th and 150th goals for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">[117]</a></sup> Ronaldo's agent, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jorge_Mendes&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jorge Mendes (page does not exist)">Jorge Mendes</a>, insisted that he always knew that Ronaldo was unhappy with life at Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">[118]</a></sup> Ronaldo dismissed the notion that his post-match declaration of "sadness" was related to a desire for a new and improved contract at the club.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">[119]</a></sup> Real Madrid president, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Florentino_P%C3%A9rez&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Florentino Pérez (page does not exist)">Florentino Pérez</a>, claimed that he did not want to leave the club and that he was unhappy for other reasons.<sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">[120]</a></sup> When Ronaldo returned to Real Madrid, after international duty, he stated he was focused on achieving further success with the club.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">[121]</a></sup> Real Madrid coach <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a> believed that UEFA's decision to elect Iniesta as the best player in Europe in 2011–12 could have been one of the reasons behind Ronaldo's unhappiness.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">[122]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">[123]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 September, Ronaldo scored his first Champions League goal of the season in a 3–2 victory over <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">[124]</a></sup> On 30 September, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick (including two penalties), his first La Liga hat-trick of the season in a 5–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_de_La_Coru%C3%B1a" title="Deportivo de La Coruña">Deportivo de La Coruña</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">[125]</a></sup> On 4 October, Ronaldo scored his first career <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_UEFA_Champions_League_hat-tricks&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks (page does not exist)">hat-trick in the Champions League</a> as he led Real Madrid to a 4–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">[126]</a></sup> Continuing his fine form, he hit a brace the following week against Barcelona in a 2–2 draw at Camp Nou, which made him the first and only player to score in six consecutive El Clásico's.<sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">[127]</a></sup> He followed this up with another goal in the following weekends against <a href="/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> in a 2–1 away loss and a brace in the 5–0 away win against <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">[128]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">[129]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em; width: 30%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>If <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Messi</a> is the best on the planet, Ronaldo is the best in the universe. If you are going to give out the Ballon d'Or because a player is the best, give it to Cristiano or Messi. But I ask: if the two are on the same level, is it normal that one wins four and the other one? It is not.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>, when asked about the 2012 Ballon d'Or.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">[130]</a></sup></div>
</div>
