<p>On 11 November, in a 2–1 away win over <a href="/wiki/Levante_UD" title="Levante UD">Levante</a>, Ronaldo received an elbow to the eye in the second minute in the match, but scored his twelfth La Liga goal to give Madrid the lead, before being substituted at half-time.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">[131]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">[132]</a></sup> This eventually led to him missing the <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> squad for the friendly game against <a href="/wiki/Gabon_national_football_team" title="Gabon national football team">Gabon</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">[133]</a></sup> On 21 November, he appeared in Madrid's 1–1 Champions League group stage draw with Manchester City at the <a href="/wiki/City_of_Manchester_Stadium" title="City of Manchester Stadium">Etihad Stadium</a>. The match represented the first time that Ronaldo played in Manchester since leaving City's rival, <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a>, for Madrid in 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">[134]</a></sup> On 1 December, after not scoring in his previous three games, Ronaldo scored a goal from a free-kick and assisted <a href="/w/index.php?title=Mesut_%C3%96zil&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesut Özil (page does not exist)">Özil</a> to score the second goal in a 2–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">[135]</a></sup> Ronaldo continued to score his sixth Champions League goal in a 4–1 home win against Ajax on 4 December, once against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Celta_de_Vigo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Celta de Vigo (page does not exist)">Celta Vigo</a> in the first leg of a <a href="/w/index.php?title=2012%E2%80%9313_Copa_del_Rey&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2012–13 Copa del Rey (page does not exist)">Copa del Rey</a> game on 12 December, and once again in a 2–2 draw with <a href="/w/index.php?title=RCD_Espanyol&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="RCD Espanyol (page does not exist)">Espanyol</a> on 16 December.
</p><p>In December 2012, French giants <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> declared interest in signing Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">[136]</a></sup> However, Real Madrid announced the club will not sell Ronaldo and the club was working on an improved contract with a three-year extension, keeping him at the club until 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-137" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-137">[137]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-138">[138]</a></sup> In April 2013, Florentino Pérez said Ronaldo's contract will be renewed,<sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">[139]</a></sup> while José Mourinho felt Ronaldo was indispensable to the club.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-140">[140]</a></sup> In May 2013, Perez said he had no intention of selling Ronaldo, who would be offered a new deal to ensure he stays with Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-141">[141]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">[142]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 6 January, in Madrid's first match of 2013, Ronaldo scored a brace to lift 10-man Real Madrid to a 4–3 victory over <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-143">[143]</a></sup> The match represented the first time that Ronaldo captained Real Madrid in an official match,<sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144">[144]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145">[145]</a></sup> but received his fifth yellow card of the season and was suspended for the team's next league game at <a href="/wiki/CA_Osasuna" title="CA Osasuna">Osasuna</a> serving a one-game ban. This was the first time Ronaldo was suspended for an accumulation of yellow cards, having only previously missed games when being given a straight red card.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">[146]</a></sup> On 7 January, he was second in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2012_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2012 FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">2012 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, for the fourth time behind Lionel Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">[147]</a></sup> On 9 January, Ronaldo scored a hat-trick against Celta Vigo in the second leg of a Copa del Rey game.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">[148]</a></sup> Following a first leg victory over <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a> in the Copa del Rey on 15 January, Ronaldo got into an argument with manager José Mourinho.<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">[149]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-150">[150]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 27 January, Ronaldo scored a perfect hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a> in a 4–0 win, including his 300th club goal.<sup id="cite_ref-151" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-151">[151]</a></sup> On 30 January, against Barcelona in the Copa del Rey, Ronaldo made his 500th club appearances. He was the first not Spanish to captain Real Madrid in a Clásico in the last 60 years.<sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-152">[152]</a></sup> On 2 February, Ronaldo scored the first own goal of his career to send Real Madrid to a shock 1–0 defeat at Granada.<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-153">[153]</a></sup> Ronaldo than scored another hat-trick the next week against Sevilla, his 21st hat-trick of his career and his 17th in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-154">[154]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo faced his former club <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> for the first time on 13 February in the Champions League Round of 16 and scored the equaliser in a 1–1 draw at the <a href="/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-155" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-155">[155]</a></sup> On 26 February, Ronaldo scored twice against Barcelona in the second leg of the Copa del Rey semi-finals, making this the sixth consecutive trip to the Camp Nou in which he had scored.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">[156]</a></sup> Ronaldo then scored the winning goal in a 2–1 victory against Manchester United on 5 March, which was his return to <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a> for the first time since his world-record £80&#160;million move to Real Madrid in 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">[157]</a></sup> Thereafter, Ronaldo stated he was "sad" and had a "strange feeling" after his goal knocked Manchester United out of the Champions League.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-158">[158]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">[159]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 10 March, Ronaldo struck twice against Celta Vigo to send Real Madrid above city rivals Atlético into second place in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-160" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-160">[160]</a></sup> The second goal, his 138 goal in La Liga, earned him a place in the top 25 goalscorers in the history of La Liga in just 127 games, recording an average of 1.08 goals per game, the highest of all the top 25 goalscorers.<sup id="cite_ref-25topLaLiga_161-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25topLaLiga-161">[161]</a></sup> On 16 March, Ronaldo scored the equaliser in a 5–2 victory against Mallorca, which was his 350 goal in his career.<sup id="cite_ref-25topLaLiga_161-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25topLaLiga-161">[161]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162">[162]</a></sup> On 3 April, Ronaldo scored the opening goal against <a href="/wiki/Galatasaray_S.K." title="Galatasaray S.K.">Galatasaray</a> in the first leg of the Champions League quarter-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">[163]</a></sup> On 9 April, Ronaldo scored twice in the second leg against Galatasaray to send Real Madrid to the semi-finals in the Champions League, winning 5–3 on aggregate.<sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-164">[164]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo picked up an injury to his leg thigh muscle while warming up for the UEFA Champions League semi-final first leg on 24 April, where he scored an away goal in a 4–1 loss against <a href="/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">[165]</a></sup> He was absent from Real Madrid's next game against Atlético Madrid,<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">[166]</a></sup> but returned to action on 30 April for the 2–0 second leg victory against Dortmund (a 4–3 aggregate loss).<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">[167]</a></sup> On 4 May, Ronaldo scored two headers against <a href="/wiki/Real_Valladolid" title="Real Valladolid">Real Valladolid</a> in a 4–3 home win.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">[168]</a></sup> The British media reported that Manchester United chief executive <a href="/w/index.php?title=David_Gill_(executive)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="David Gill (executive) (page does not exist)">David Gill</a> was in Madrid to talk with Ronaldo's agent about a return to Old Trafford,<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">[169]</a></sup> but other media outlets reported that United would struggle to re-sign him after the announcement of <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a>'s retirement as manager of Manchester United.<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">[170]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">[171]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored his 200th goal for Real Madrid on 8 May in a 6–2 win against <a href="/w/index.php?title=CD_M%C3%A1laga&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="CD Málaga (page does not exist)">Málaga</a>. This figure made him sixth in the list of the club's all-time top scorers and the player that took fewest matches (197) to reach 200 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">[172]</a></sup> On 17 May, Ronaldo headed the opening goal from a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Mesut_%C3%96zil&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesut Özil (page does not exist)">Mesut Özil</a> corner in the 14th minute against Atletico Madrid in the eventual 2–1 <a href="/w/index.php?title=2013_Copa_del_Rey_Final&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2013 Copa del Rey Final (page does not exist)">Copa del Rey final</a> loss, which was also his 111 goal (201 overall) in his 100th home appearance.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">[173]</a></sup> He was shown a straight red card in the 114th minute of extra time of the final for an altercation with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gabriel_Fern%C3%A1ndez_Arenas&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gabriel Fernández Arenas (page does not exist)">Gabi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">[174]</a></sup> He was charged for the accumulation of yellow cards and violent conduct by the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Royal_Spanish_Football_Federation&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Royal Spanish Football Federation (page does not exist)">RFEF</a>, banned for the two games in the last 16 of the 2013–14 Copa del Rey.<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">[175]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo ended his fourth season at Real Madrid as the <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_European_Cup_and_UEFA_Champions_League_top_scorers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League top scorers (page does not exist)">Champions League top goalscorer</a> for a second time in his career, with 12 goals. In the league, Real Madrid failed to defend their La Liga title, finishing runners up to arch-rivals Barcelona, and were eliminated in the semi-finals in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2012-13_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2012-13 UEFA Champions League knockout phase (page does not exist)">UEFA Champions League</a> for the third consecutive year. Accounting for all competitions, Ronaldo ended the season with a total of 55 goals, having scored 30 goals with his right foot, 17 with his left foot and 8 with his head.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">[176]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2013.E2.80.9314_season">2013–14 season</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_vs_Galatasaray_(1).JPG" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo vs Galatasaray (1).JPG">File:Cristiano Ronaldo vs Galatasaray (1).JPG</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Galatasaray_S.K._(football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Galatasaray S.K. (football) (page does not exist)">Galatasaray</a> during their <a href="/w/index.php?title=2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage (page does not exist)">group stage match</a> in the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> on 17 September 2013.</div></div></div>
<p>Real Madrid's failure to win major silverware last season and reports of division in the dressing room had prompted speculation that Ronaldo, whose contract runs until June 2015, might be seeking a move away from the Spanish capital.<sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177">[177]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">[178]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-179" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-179">[179]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">[180]</a></sup> On 8 June 2013, Ronaldo moved to quell the speculation over his future by insisting that he would reach a deal to renew his contract with Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">[181]</a></sup> On 3 July 2013, Ronaldo admitted that he was missing the English <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a>, but ruled out an imminent move back to <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">[182]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 August 2013, Ronaldo made his 200th competitive appearance for Real Madrid in a 2–1 home win over <a href="/wiki/Real_Betis" title="Real Betis">Real Betis</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">[183]</a></sup> Ronaldo had not scored during the first two league games, but against <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> on 1 September 2013, he scored his first of the season in a 3–1 home victory.<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">[184]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 15 September 2013, after much speculation, Ronaldo signed a new contract with Real Madrid that will keep him at the club until 2018,<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">[185]</a></sup> with a salary of €21&#160;million (after taxes), which makes him the highest paid players in football.<sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">[186]</a></sup> On 17 September 2013, Ronaldo scored the second Champions League hat-trick of his career in Real Madrid's opening group match of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League (page does not exist)">2013–14 UEFA Champions League</a>, a 6–1 away win against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Galatasaray_S.K._(football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Galatasaray S.K. (football) (page does not exist)">Galatasaray</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">[187]</a></sup> On 22 September 2013, Ronaldo scored a brace in a 4–1 home victory against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe CF</a>, including his 209th goal in his 205th game, to become the fifth highest scorer in the club's history.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">[188]</a></sup>
</p><p>In his 100th game in the European competitions against <a href="/wiki/F.C._Copenhagen" title="F.C. Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a> on 2 October 2013, Ronaldo scored a brace as Real Madrid went on to a 4–0 home victory.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">[189]</a></sup> On 5 October 2013, Ronaldo scored a late winning goal against <a href="/wiki/Levante_UD" title="Levante UD">Levante</a>, which made him the first player in the big five European leagues to score 50 goals in 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">[190]</a></sup> On 23 October 2013, Ronaldo scored twice in a 2–1 home victory against <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a> to become the Champions League's third all-time highest goalscorer with 57 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">[191]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">[192]</a></sup> On 30 October 2013, Ronaldo scored his 18th La Liga hat-trick and his 23rd overall in a 7–3 home win against <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">[193]</a></sup>
</p><p>In a debate at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Oxford_Union&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Oxford Union (page does not exist)">Oxford Union</a> in October 2013, when asked whether FIFA president Sepp Blatter preferred Messi or Ronaldo, Blatter paid tribute to the work ethic of the Argentine before taking a swipe at Ronaldo, claiming "one of them has more expenses for the hairdresser than the other". Real Madrid demanded – and promptly received – a full apology, and the Portuguese issued his own riposte with a mock-salute celebration after scoring a penalty against Sevilla, after Blatter had described him as a "commander" on the pitch.<sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">[194]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">[195]</a></sup>
</p><p>In his 106 away appearances for Real Madrid on 2 November 2013, Ronaldo scored his 100th away goal as he hit a brace in a 3–2 away victory against <a href="/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a>, averaging 0.94 per game.<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">[196]</a></sup> On 5 November 2013, Ronaldo broke the record held for Champions League goals scored in a calendar year with 14 goals, after he equalised for Real Madrid in a 2–2 draw at Juventus.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">[197]</a></sup> On 9 November 2013, Ronaldo scored his 19th La Liga hat-trick (one from open play, a penalty and a direct free-kick) in a 5–1 home victory against <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a>, which made him second in the all time League hat-trick list. The direct free-kick was his 20th direct free-kick goal for Real Madrid, one more than free-kick specialist <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a> scored with Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">[198]</a></sup>
</p><p>After his strong form in the 2013–14 campaign by which he had scored 32 goals from 22 matches played for both club and country by the middle of November 2013, including five hat-tricks, Ronaldo suggested that he could be in the "best form of his life".<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">[199]</a></sup> On 23 November 2013, Ronaldo was replaced by <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jes%C3%A9&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jesé (page does not exist)">Jesé</a> in the 52nd minute against <a href="/w/index.php?title=UD_Almer%C3%ADa&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UD Almería (page does not exist)">Almería</a> after suffering a muscle strain, which would keep him out for one to two weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">[200]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201">[201]</a></sup> Ronaldo made his return for Real Madrid in a 2–0 away victory against Copenhagen in the Champions League on 10 December 2013, and went on to break the record for most goals scored in the Champions League group stages with 9 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-CL_Record_202-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CL_Record-202">[202]</a></sup> His final match of the calendar year saw him score a header in a 3–2 away win against <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a>, ending the year with a tally of 69 goals in 59 appearance, his highest year-end goal tally.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">[203]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204">[204]</a></sup> With the goal, he became the club's fourth top scorer in the league with 164 league goals, equalling the tally gained by <a href="/wiki/Hugo_S%C3%A1nchez" title="Hugo Sánchez">Hugo Sánchez</a>. He also become the second top scorer in matches played away from home with 72 goals, 15 behind the record holder <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_(footballer)" title="Raúl (footballer)">Raúl</a> with 87.<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">[205]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: left; clear: left; margin: 0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0; width: 25%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>Ronaldo is a unique player for all of his talent and his professionalism. He is a player who is extraordinarily consistent.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— <a href="/wiki/Carlo_Ancelotti" title="Carlo Ancelotti">Carlo Ancelotti</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-206" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-206">[206]</a></sup></div>
</div>
<p>In Real Madrid's first match following the 2013–14 winter break, Ronaldo score a brace in a 3–0 home victory against <a href="/w/index.php?title=Celta_de_Vigo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Celta de Vigo (page does not exist)">Celta Vigo</a>, including his 400th career goal in 653 games for club and country. He dedicated his two goals to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Eus%C3%A9bio&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eusébio (page does not exist)">Eusébio</a>, who had died two days before.<sup id="cite_ref-400Goals_11-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400Goals-11">[11]</a></sup> With the brace, he also reached 230 goals in just 221 appearances for Real Madrid in all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">[207]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 13 January 2014, Ronaldo won the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2013_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2013 FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">2013 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, beating <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, who had won the prize the previous four years, and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Franck_Rib%C3%A9ry&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Franck Ribéry (page does not exist)">Franck Ribéry</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-BallondOr2014_208-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BallondOr2014-208">[208]</a></sup> This was his second Ballon d'Or overall and his first since winning the prize in 2008, thereby became the 10th multiple winner of the football's top individual prize.<sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-209">[209]</a></sup> He also became the sixth player in history to collect the accolade despite not winning a major trophy in the calendar year,<sup id="cite_ref-210" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-210">[210]</a></sup> and the third player to win the award after playing at least a full calendar year at Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-211" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-211">[211]</a></sup> Ronaldo had been runner-up on another four occasions: 2007, 2009, 2011 and 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-212" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-212">[212]</a></sup> A tearful Ronaldo described receiving the accolade as "no words to describe this moment" and "it's hard to win this award".<sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">[213]</a></sup> The achievement fuelled media to recognise Ronaldo as one of the greatest players in football history,<sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214">[214]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">[215]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">[216]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-217" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-217">[217]</a></sup> with Brazil great <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> stating that Ronaldo must continue to maintain his exceptional high standards.<sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-218">[218]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 18 January 2014, Ronaldo netted a long-range finish that nestled to the top right corner in a 5–0 away win over Real Betis.<sup id="cite_ref-219" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-219">[219]</a></sup> In Madrid's next league, Ronaldo scored the opening goal in a 2–0 home win over <a href="/w/index.php?title=Granada_CF&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Granada CF (page does not exist)">Granada</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-220">[220]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_career">International career</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Portugal_vs_Brazil.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo Portugal vs Brazil.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo Portugal vs Brazil.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo playing against <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> in February 2007.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo earned his first cap for <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> in a 1–0 victory against <a href="/wiki/Kazakhstan_national_football_team" title="Kazakhstan national football team">Kazakhstan</a> on 20 August 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-221" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-221">[221]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Euro_2004_and_2004_Summer_Olympics">Euro 2004 and 2004 Summer Olympics</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo was called up for <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">Euro 2004</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-222" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-222">[222]</a></sup> scoring his first international goal in a 2–1 group stage loss to eventual champions <a href="/wiki/Greece_national_football_team" title="Greece national football team">Greece</a><sup id="cite_ref-223" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-223">[223]</a></sup> and scoring again in a 2–1 semi-final win over the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Netherlands_national_football_team&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Netherlands national football team (page does not exist)">Netherlands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-224">[224]</a></sup> He was featured in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_European_Football_Championship_Teams_of_the_Tournament&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA European Football Championship Teams of the Tournament (page does not exist)">UEFA Euro All-Star Team</a> of this competition, providing two assists,<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">[225]</a></sup> despite finishing with only two goals.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo_profile_226-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo_profile-226">[226]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo also represented Portugal at the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Football_at_the_2004_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament (page does not exist)">2004 Summer Olympics</a>, scoring a goal in the tournament, although the Portuguese Olympic football squad was eliminated in the first round, finishing bottom of their group with three points.<sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227">[227]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228">[228]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2006_World_Cup">2006 World Cup</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo was the second-highest scorer in <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(UEFA)" title="2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)">World Cup qualification</a> in the European zone with seven goals,<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo_profile_226-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo_profile-226">[226]</a></sup> and scored his first <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> goal against <a href="/wiki/Iran_national_football_team" title="Iran national football team">Iran</a> with a penalty kick.<sup id="cite_ref-Por._Vs_Iran_229-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Por._Vs_Iran-229">[229]</a></sup>
</p><p>During a <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup#Quarter-finals" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">quarter-final match</a> against <a href="/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">England</a> on 1 July 2006, Ronaldo's United teammate <a href="/wiki/Wayne_Rooney" title="Wayne Rooney">Wayne Rooney</a> was <a href="/w/index.php?title=Misconduct_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Misconduct (association football) (page does not exist)">sent off</a> for stamping on Portugal defender <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Carvalho" title="Ricardo Carvalho">Ricardo Carvalho</a>. The English media speculated that Ronaldo had influenced referee <a href="/w/index.php?title=Horacio_Elizondo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Horacio Elizondo (page does not exist)">Horacio Elizondo</a>'s decision by aggressively complaining, after which he was seen in replays winking at the Portuguese bench following Rooney's dismissal. After the match, Ronaldo insisted that Rooney was a friend and that he was not pushing for Rooney to be sent off.<sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230">[230]</a></sup> On 4 July, Elizondo clarified that the red card was due to Rooney's infraction and not the fracas between Rooney and Ronaldo that followed.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231">[231]</a></sup>
</p><p>The angry reaction from the English press caused Ronaldo to consider leaving United,<sup id="cite_ref-muLeave_232-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-muLeave-232">[232]</a></sup> and he allegedly told Spanish sports daily <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Marca_(newspaper)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Marca (newspaper) (page does not exist)">Marca</a></i> that he wished to move to <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">[233]</a></sup> In response to the speculation, Ferguson sent Portuguese assistant manager <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Queiroz" title="Carlos Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a> to speak to Ronaldo in attempt to change his mind, a sentiment that was shared by Rooney.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">[234]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235">[235]</a></sup> Ronaldo stayed, and signed his new five-year extension in April 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-236" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-236">[236]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was booed during Portugal's semi-final defeat to <a href="/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team">France</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">[237]</a></sup> and missed out on the competition's Best Young Player award due to a negative e-mail campaign from England fans.<sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">[238]</a></sup> Though the online vote only affected the nomination process, FIFA's Technical Study Group awarded the honour to <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Lukas_Podolski" title="Lukas Podolski">Lukas Podolski</a>, citing Ronaldo's behaviour as a factor in the decision.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">[239]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Post-World_Cup">Post-World Cup</span></h4>
<p>One day after his 22nd birthday, Ronaldo captained Portugal for the first time in a friendly against <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> on 6 February 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240">[240]</a></sup> This move was in honour of <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_Football_Federation" title="Portuguese Football Federation">Portuguese Football Federation</a> president Carlos Silva, who had died two days earlier. Portugal coach <a href="/wiki/Luiz_Felipe_Scolari" title="Luiz Felipe Scolari">Luiz Felipe Scolari</a> explained, "Mr. Silva asked me to make [Ronaldo] captain as a gesture... [he] is too young to be captain, but Mr. Silva asked me, and now he is no longer with us."<sup id="cite_ref-Rediff_captain_241-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rediff_captain-241">[241]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Euro_2008">Euro 2008</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Dagur_Brynj%C3%B3lfsson.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo - Dagur Brynjólfsson.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo - Dagur Brynjólfsson.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo was made full-time captain of Portugal in 2008.</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo scored eight goals in Portugal's <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2008_qualifying&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying (page does not exist)">UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying</a> campaign,<sup id="cite_ref-Euro_08_qualifying_top_scorers_242-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Euro_08_qualifying_top_scorers-242">[242]</a></sup> behind Poland's <a href="/w/index.php?title=Euzebiusz_Smolarek&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Euzebiusz Smolarek (page does not exist)">Ebi Smolarek</a>, but finished with only one goal in the tournament as Portugal were eliminated in the quarter-finals with a 2–3 loss against <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-243">[243]</a></sup>
</p><p>When Portugal's <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2008_squads&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2008 squads (page does not exist)">squad</a> for the tournament was announced, Ronaldo was given the number 7 shirt previously worn by <a href="/wiki/Lu%C3%ADs_Figo" title="Luís Figo">Luís Figo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-244">[244]</a></sup> Ronaldo was named Man of the Match against the <a href="/wiki/Czech_Republic_national_football_team" title="Czech Republic national football team">Czech Republic</a> in <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2008_Group_A&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2008 Group A (page does not exist)">Group A</a> of the European championships.<sup id="cite_ref-cze-por_report_245-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cze-por_report-245">[245]</a></sup>
</p><p>When <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Queiroz" title="Carlos Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a> was named Portugal's new coach in July 2008,<sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">[246]</a></sup> he appointed Ronaldo as team captain.<sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">[247]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2010_World_Cup">2010 World Cup</span></h3>
<p>On 15 June 2010, in Portugal's opening <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> match against <a href="/w/index.php?title=C%C3%B4te_d%27Ivoire_national_football_team&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Côte d'Ivoire national football team (page does not exist)">Côte d'Ivoire</a>, Ronaldo was tackled by right-back <a href="/w/index.php?title=Guy_Demel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Guy Demel (page does not exist)">Guy Demel</a>, which led to an argument and both being booked. The next day, Portugal contacted FIFA to suggest that Ronaldo's yellow card be rescinded since he was "pulled into" the confrontation after having already moved away from the spot where he was tackled, but the appeal was rejected.<sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-248">[248]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was named Man of the Match in all three of Portugal's <a href="/w/index.php?title=2010_FIFA_World_Cup_Group_G&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2010 FIFA World Cup Group G (page does not exist)">Group G matches</a> at the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-cot-por_report_249-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cot-por_report-249">[249]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-pkr-por_report_250-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pkr-por_report-250">[250]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bra-por_report_251-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bra-por_report-251">[251]</a></sup> His only goal of the tournament came in Portugal's 7–0 group stage thrashing of <a href="/wiki/North_Korea_national_football_team" title="North Korea national football team">North Korea</a> on 21 June,<sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-252">[252]</a></sup> which marked his first international goal in 16 months.<sup id="cite_ref-wsj_253-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wsj-253">[253]</a></sup> Portugal was ultimately eliminated by <a href="/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a> in the Round of 16.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Euro_2012">Euro 2012</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo scored seven goals in Portugal's <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2012_qualifying&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying (page does not exist)">UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying</a> campaign, including two strikes against <a href="/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina_national_football_team" title="Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team">Bosnia</a> in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2012_qualifying_play-offs&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying play-offs (page does not exist)">play-offs</a> for the tournament, and finished behind Germany's <a href="/wiki/Miroslav_Klose" title="Miroslav Klose">Miroslav Klose</a> and the Netherlands' <a href="/w/index.php?title=Klaas-Jan_Huntelaar&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (page does not exist)">Klaas-Jan Huntelaar</a> (not including the play-offs round). Portugal were drawn in Group B with <a href="/w/index.php?title=Netherlands_national_football_team&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Netherlands national football team (page does not exist)">Netherlands</a>, <a href="/wiki/Denmark_national_football_team" title="Denmark national football team">Denmark</a> and <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a>, which was widely referred to as the "<a href="/w/index.php?title=Group_of_death&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Group of death (page does not exist)">group of death</a>" of the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254">[254]</a></sup> In an interview with <i>Kicker Magazine</i>, Ronaldo stated that: "I will only be fully content with my career when I have lifted a trophy with Portugal."<sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255">[255]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-256">[256]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-257">[257]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:GER-POR_Euro_2012_(18).jpg" title="File:GER-POR Euro 2012 (18).jpg">File:GER-POR Euro 2012 (18).jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo against <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a> during their group stage match at <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2012" title="UEFA Euro 2012">UEFA Euro 2012</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>After the opening 0–1 defeat against <a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team">Germany</a>, Ronaldo was criticised for under performing, showing frustration at his and his team-mates' errors and for walking off into the changing-rooms straight after the match, rather than thanking the crowd with the team. Ronaldo's team-mate, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nani (page does not exist)">Nani</a>, later defended him, stating that he had left the pitch as he needed to instantly be treated for a possible injury. He also stated that Ronaldo had been training well and contributing greatly to the team, also adding that he was under excessive pressure, as football is a team sport. Nani finally stated that he believed that Ronaldo would soon silence his critics. <a href="/wiki/Lu%C3%ADs_Figo" title="Luís Figo">Luís Figo</a>, however, criticised Ronaldo's behaviour, stating that it is the captain's responsibility to always defend the group, despite the result.<sup id="cite_ref-258" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-258">[258]</a></sup>
</p><p>During the match between <a href="/wiki/Denmark_national_football_team" title="Denmark national football team">Denmark</a> and <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a>, the Denmark fans chanted <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>'s name whenever Ronaldo was on the ball. Ronaldo squandered two gilt-edged one-on-one chances, and Ronaldo looked frustrated and tormented throughout.<sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-259">[259]</a></sup> Asked about the Messi chants, Ronaldo responded irritatedly: "You know where <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">he</a> was at this time last year? Do you know? He was being eliminated in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2011 Copa América (page does not exist)">Copa America</a>, in his own country. I think that's worse, no? And people say that he is the best player in the world. This sort of thing is normal for great players."<sup id="cite_ref-260" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-260">[260]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: left; clear: left; margin: 0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0; width: 25%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>In the form he is in, given the chance, he will score. Cristiano wants to bring his team to the final and show why he should be considered the best player in the world.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, on Ronaldo's opportunity to take Portugal to the final.<sup id="cite_ref-261" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-261">[261]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ronaldo_monument_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ronaldo_monument-262">[262]</a></sup></div>
</div>
<p>In the final group match between Portugal and the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Netherlands_national_football_team&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Netherlands national football team (page does not exist)">Netherlands</a>, Ronaldo scored two goals to secure a 2–1 victory for Portugal, allowing them to advance to the quarterfinals. He also struck the post twice in the match and was named <a href="/w/index.php?title=UEFA_Euro_2012_Group_B&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="UEFA Euro 2012 Group B (page does not exist)">Man of the Match</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-263">[263]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-264">[264]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was praised for his performance against the <a href="/wiki/Czech_Republic_national_football_team" title="Czech Republic national football team">Czech Republic</a> in the quarter-finals. After he had twice hit the post, he finally darted in from behind his marker in the 79th minute and headed a cross from <a href="/w/index.php?title=Joao_Moutinho&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Joao Moutinho (page does not exist)">Joao Moutinho</a>, sending Portugal into the semifinals with a 1–0 victory over the Czech Republic. After scoring the winning goal, he ran to the camera and was initially accused of chanting "Messi" mockingly, although upon further review, it was found that this was incorrect and that he had in fact simply stated "para ti" as he had dedicated the goal to his son.<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">[265]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-266">[266]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo had several chances for Portugal in the semi-final against <a href="/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a>, but he sent three shots over the bar.<sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-267">[267]</a></sup> He had his best chance in the 90th minute, but shot the ball high and wide.<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">[268]</a></sup> The match ended with penalties, but Ronaldo did not take a penalty in the shootout as he had been slated to take the fifth one, but it never got that far.<sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-269">[269]</a></sup> The Portugal coach, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Paulo_Bento&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paulo Bento (page does not exist)">Paulo Bento</a>, knocked back criticism of Ronaldo not being employed earlier in the shootout: "Well we had this plan and if it would have been 4–4 and he would have taken the last penalty we would talk in a different way."<sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270">[270]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">[271]</a></sup>
</p><p>Before and throughout the tournament, Ronaldo was particularly hailed by Argentine great <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who described Ronaldo as "the best player on the planet" and went on to say that "[Ronaldo] has shown his countrymen that he does deserve a monument in Lisbon."<sup id="cite_ref-ronaldo_monument_262-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ronaldo_monument-262">[262]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-best2012_272-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-best2012-272">[272]</a></sup> Ronaldo was included in the UEFA Euro 2012 Team of the Tournament, the second time after 2004, and finished the competition as the joint best scorer with three goals, along with five other players, although Spain's <a href="/wiki/Fernando_Torres" title="Fernando Torres">Fernando Torres</a> claimed the Golden Boot.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2014_World_Cup_cycle">2014 World Cup cycle</span></h3>
<p>On 17 October 2012, Ronaldo won his <a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_footballers_with_100_or_more_caps&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="List of footballers with 100 or more caps (page does not exist)">100th</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cap_(sport)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cap (sport) (page does not exist)">cap</a> for the Portugal national team in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(UEFA)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA) (page does not exist)">World Cup qualification</a> match against <a href="/wiki/Northern_Ireland_national_football_team" title="Northern Ireland national football team">Northern Ireland</a> at <a href="/wiki/Porto" title="Porto">Porto</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_do_Drag%C3%A3o" title="Estádio do Dragão">Estádio do Dragão</a>. He became the third youngest European ever to reach that figure in the process, after Germany's <a href="/wiki/Lukas_Podolski" title="Lukas Podolski">Lukas Podolski</a> and Estonia's <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kristen_Viikm%C3%A4e&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kristen Viikmäe (page does not exist)">Kristen Viikmäe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">[273]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 14 August 2013, Ronaldo scored his 40th goal for Portugal in a 1–1 friendly draw against the Netherlands.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">[274]</a></sup> On 6 September 2013, Ronaldo netted his first international hat-trick in a 15-minute spell in the second half at <a href="/wiki/Windsor_Park" title="Windsor Park">Windsor Park</a> against Northern Ireland in a World Cup qualification match to become Portugal's second-highest scorer ahead of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Eus%C3%A9bio&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eusébio (page does not exist)">Eusébio</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275">[275]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276">[276]</a></sup> With his goals against Northern Ireland, Ronaldo also established a personal record, since it was the first time that he scored in three consecutive matches with Portugal.<sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-277">[277]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored eight goals in Portugal's FIFA World Cup 2014 qualifying campaign, including all four of the team's goals in the two-legged <a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_%E2%80%93_UEFA_Second_Round&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Second Round (page does not exist)">play-off</a> against <a href="/wiki/Sweden_national_football_team" title="Sweden national football team">Sweden</a> which ensured Portugal's place at the finals.<sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278">[278]</a></sup> His hat-trick in the second-leg made him Portugal's <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team#Most_goals" title="Portugal national football team">joint-top goalscorer</a> of all-time after equalling <a href="/wiki/Pauleta" title="Pauleta">Pauleta</a>'s record tally of 47 international goals.<sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279">[279]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Style_of_play">Style of play</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_20120609.jpg" title="File:Cristiano Ronaldo 20120609.jpg">File:Cristiano Ronaldo 20120609.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Ronaldo, playing for Portugal in 2012, has been compared to four-time <a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFA Ballon d'Or (page does not exist)">FIFA</a>/<a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or_(1956%E2%80%932009)" title="Ballon d'Or (1956–2009)">Ballon d'Or</a> winner <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Widely regarded as one of the two best players in the world within his generation (along with Lionel Messi), and as one of the best players to ever play the game,<sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280">[280]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-281" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-281">[281]</a></sup> Cristiano Ronaldo plays an <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">attacking</a> role, most often playing as either a striker or as a winger,<sup id="cite_ref-282" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-282">[282]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283">[283]</a></sup> and is known for his finishing, pace, dribbling, positioning and his passing, crossing, freekick ability.<sup id="cite_ref-bio_73-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bio-73">[73]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-284">[284]</a></sup> He is able to play on either wing as well through the center of the pitch, making him a very versatile attacker.<sup id="cite_ref-285" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-285">[285]</a></sup>
</p><p>Tactically, Ronaldo plays a powerful attacking role, often drifting from the left wing into the centre when moving off the ball.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">[286]</a></sup> Ronaldo is known to be mentally sharp, with good vision, predicting certain plays, and also possesses very good reactions, balance and agility. Although right footed, he is also able to control the ball and cross and finish well with his left foot.<sup id="cite_ref-287" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-287">[287]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-288">[288]</a></sup>
</p><p>Cristiano Ronaldo is known for his pace, skill, control and dribbling ability, as well as his flair in beating players during one on one situations. He is able to finish well both inside the area and from distance.<sup id="cite_ref-bio_73-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bio-73">[73]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-289">[289]</a></sup> He is also an accurate set piece and penalty kick specialist.<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-290">[290]</a></sup> Uniquely, his height, strength, jumping ability and heading technique have given him an edge in winning aerial challenges for balls, with the majority of his goals often being headers.<sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">[291]</a></sup>
</p><p>Since his arrival at Manchester United, Ronaldo underwent a major body transformation, from a skinny youth to an athletically built adult. His well-built, muscular body type allows him to retain possession of the ball.<sup id="cite_ref-goalscoresoccer1_292-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-goalscoresoccer1-292">[292]</a></sup> Many figures in the football world have praised Ronaldo's incredible work ethic, dedication to improvement on the training field and have stated that he has been renowned for this such as former Manchester United strength and conditioning coach Mike Clegg, and French legend <a href="/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane" title="Zinedine Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-293" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-293">[293]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">[294]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">[295]</a></sup> Ronaldo once stated his desire to carve his name in history alongside footballing legends such as <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-296">[296]</a></sup> and that he would rather be remembered as a role model than one of world football's best players.<sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-297">[297]</a></sup>
</p><p>However, Ronaldo has at times been criticised for some of his performances in the national team, on which Maradona has commented: "As good as he is with Real Madrid, he often seems frustrated on the national level, as if he was surrounded by players who do little to assist him."<sup id="cite_ref-best2012_272-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-best2012-272">[272]</a></sup> Ronaldo also has been criticised for his <a href="/w/index.php?title=Diving_(association_football)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Diving (association football) (page does not exist)">diving</a> when tackled. For which <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a> said: "Cristiano is a player who does not have the culture of the swimming pool, he has no culture of simulation, he is a British-trained player, <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Ferguson</a> trained. In some cases, the simulators are given more protection, and those who are honest are often the losers. I'm not a hypocrite if I say that they (defenders) hit Cristiano very hard, and that the yellow cards do not arrive or are slow in coming."<sup id="cite_ref-298" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-298">[298]</a></sup> However, Mourinho suggested that Ronaldo does not take criticism well,<sup id="cite_ref-299" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-299">[299]</a></sup> but steadfast that Ronaldo is "the most professional players I've ever met."<sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">[300]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox" style="float: right; clear: right; margin: 0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em; width: 30%; padding: 6px; border: 1px solid #aaa; font-size: 88%; background-color: #F9F9F9;">
<div style="position: relative; text-align: left;">
<div style="margin:0px 2em;">
<p>There has always been big talk about Ronaldo and his attitude and all of that, but at some point you have to stop talking about attitude and look at the stats and what he has been doing. Stop talking and just watch. What he's been doing has been crazy.
</p>
</div>
<div style="position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">“</div>
<div style="position: absolute; right: 0px; bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-family:&#39;Times New Roman&#39;,serif; font-weight:bold; font-size: large; color: gray;">”</div></div>
<div style="text-align: left;">— Former French star <a href="/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-301" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-301">[301]</a></sup></div>
</div>
<p>Earlier in his career, Ronaldo had been described as having an "arrogant image" on the field, with Ronaldo stating that he had become a "victim", because of how he was portrayed in the media.<sup id="cite_ref-personality_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personality-302">[302]</a></sup> He is often seen moaning, gesticulating and scowling while trying to inspire his team to victory, with Ronaldo insisting that his competitive nature should not be mistaken for arrogance.<sup id="cite_ref-personality_302-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personality-302">[302]</a></sup> Former Portugal coach <a href="/wiki/Luiz_Felipe_Scolari" title="Luiz Felipe Scolari">Luiz Felipe Scolari</a> stated that people are "jealous" of him,<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">[303]</a></sup> while compatriot <a href="/w/index.php?title=Pepe_(footballer_born_1983)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pepe (footballer born 1983) (page does not exist)">Pepe</a> highlighted Ronaldo's "character" and "desire to win".<sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">[304]</a></sup> In 2014, Ronaldo told <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i> that he had made a "mistake" when he said in 2011, "People are jealous of me as I am young handsome and rich", adding that he had matured since then and fans understood him better.<sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">[305]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo's direct football style, skill and goalscoring ability have been his most noticeable traits throughout his career, and his overall talent has at times led him to be considered a player who stands out and who can be a match changer.<sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">[306]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo's increasing production led the media to draw comparisons between him and <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> forward <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">[307]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">[308]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-309">[309]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">[310]</a></sup> which Ronaldo has commented on saying: "Some people say I'm better, other people say it's him, but at the end of the day, they're going to decide who is the best player. He does the best things for Barcelona, I do the best things for Madrid. I think we push each other sometimes in the competition, this is why the competition is so high."<sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">[311]</a></sup> However, some former great players have criticised the comparison, such as Brazilian legend Pelé and former Portuguese international <a href="/wiki/Luis_Figo" title="Luis Figo" class="mw-redirect">Luis Figo</a>, who cited that they have different playing styles.<sup id="cite_ref-312" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-312">[312]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">[313]</a></sup> Though the comparison has been criticised, many figures in the football world have cited Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo as the world's finest players.<sup id="cite_ref-best2012_272-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-best2012-272">[272]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314">[314]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315">[315]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-316" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-316">[316]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-317" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-317">[317]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-318" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-318">[318]</a></sup> Former Brazilian star <a href="/wiki/Roberto_Carlos_(footballer)" title="Roberto Carlos (footballer)">Roberto Carlos</a> suggested that "...Ronaldo can do much more for Madrid than Messi can for Barcelona. Madrid really depend on Ronaldo to perform well, while Barcelona are so much more than Messi."<sup id="cite_ref-319" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-319">[319]</a></sup> Former Chelsea striker <a href="/wiki/Didier_Drogba" title="Didier Drogba">Didier Drogba</a> even labelled the duo as "monsters" for revolutionising statistics for goals scored.<sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-320">[320]</a></sup> Ronaldo's former Real Madrid manager, <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>, once stated: "If both Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo were born in different eras, they would have ruled the football scene and collected 10 FIFA Ballon d'Ors each."<sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321">[321]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Prettyquote&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Prettyquote (page does not exist)">Template:Prettyquote</a>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Outside_football">Outside football</span></h2>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Infobox_person&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Infobox person (page does not exist)">Template:Infobox person</a>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo's father, José Dinis Aveiro, died of an alcoholism-related liver condition at the age of 52 in September 2005 when Ronaldo was 20.<sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322">[322]</a></sup> Ronaldo has said that he does not drink alcohol and he received <a href="/w/index.php?title=Libel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Libel (page does not exist)">libel</a> damages over a <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_Mirror" title="Daily Mirror">Daily Mirror</a></i> article that reported him drinking heavily in a nightclub while recovering from an injury in July 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">[323]</a></sup>
</p><p>In October 2005, a month after his father died, Ronaldo was arrested on suspicion of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Rape&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rape (page does not exist)">raping</a> a woman in a London hotel and released on bail.<sup id="cite_ref-Rape_allegation_324-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rape_allegation-324">[324]</a></sup> Ronaldo denied the allegations and charges were dropped by <a href="/wiki/Scotland_Yard" title="Scotland Yard">Scotland Yard</a> in November 2005 due to "insufficient evidence". Ronaldo issued a statement saying: "I have always strongly maintained my innocence of any wrong-doing and I am glad that this matter is at an end so that I can concentrate on playing for Manchester United."<sup id="cite_ref-Charges_dropped_325-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Charges_dropped-325">[325]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo announced that he had become a father on 3 July 2010. His official Facebook and Twitter pages refer to the birth of his son and request privacy.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_child_326-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc_child-326">[326]</a></sup> The child, named Cristiano<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">[327]</a></sup> is in full custody of Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_child_326-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc_child-326">[326]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo has previously dated English models <a href="/w/index.php?title=Alice_Goodwin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alice Goodwin (page does not exist)">Alice Goodwin</a><sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">[328]</a></sup> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gemma_Atkinson&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gemma Atkinson (page does not exist)">Gemma Atkinson</a>, and since the start of 2010, he has been dating Russian model <a href="/w/index.php?title=Irina_Shayk&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Irina Shayk (page does not exist)">Irina Shayk</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">[329]</a></sup> He is a practising <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic" title="Roman Catholic" class="mw-redirect">Roman Catholic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-330">[330]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Philanthropy">Philanthropy</span></h3>
<p>Television footage of the <a href="/wiki/2004_Indian_Ocean_earthquake_and_tsunami" title="2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami">2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami</a> showed an eight-year-old boy survivor named Martunis wearing a No. 7 Portuguese football jersey who was stranded for 19 days after his family was killed. Following this, Ronaldo visited <a href="/wiki/Aceh" title="Aceh">Aceh</a>, Indonesia, to raise funds for rehabilitation and reconstruction.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">[331]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-332">[332]</a></sup> After accepting undisclosed damages from a libel case against <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Sun_(United_Kingdom)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Sun (United Kingdom) (page does not exist)">The Sun</a></i> newspaper in 2008, Ronaldo donated the damages to a charity in <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">[333]</a></sup> In 2009, Ronaldo donated £100,000 to the hospital that saved his mother's life in <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a> following her battle with cancer, so that they could build a cancer centre in his native island Madeira.<sup id="cite_ref-334" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-334">[334]</a></sup> In support of the victims of the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2010_Madeira_floods_and_mudslides&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2010 Madeira floods and mudslides (page does not exist)">2010 Madeira flood</a>, Ronaldo pledged to play in a charity match in Madeira between the <a href="/wiki/Primeira_Liga" title="Primeira Liga">Primeira Liga</a> club <a href="/wiki/F.C._Porto" title="F.C. Porto">FC Porto</a> and players from Madeiran based clubs <a href="/wiki/C.S._Mar%C3%ADtimo" title="C.S. Marítimo">Marítimo</a> and <a href="/wiki/C.D._Nacional" title="C.D. Nacional">Nacional</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Reuters22Feb2010CharityMatch_335-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Reuters22Feb2010CharityMatch-335">[335]</a></sup>
</p><p>In November 2011, Ronaldo donated a pair of his football boots to be auctioned by Real Madrid's 'Clasico' network. They were sold for £2050 with the proceeds going to fund schools in <a href="/wiki/Gaza" title="Gaza">Gaza</a>, Palestine.<sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-336">[336]</a></sup> In May 2012, Ronaldo and his agent, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jorge_Mendes&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jorge Mendes (page does not exist)">Jorge Mendes</a>, decided to fund a pioneering treatment for a nine-year-old boy when it seemed that there was no hope left for the child, who has been battling cancer since before his second birthday.<sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">[337]</a></sup> In November 2012, Ronaldo sold the golden boot he had won in 2011 for €1.5&#160;million and gave the money to fund schools for children in Gaza.<sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338">[338]</a></sup> In December 2012, Ronaldo joined FIFA's '11 for Health' programme to raise awareness amongst kids of how to steer clear of conditions including drug addiction, HIV, malaria and obesity.<sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-339">[339]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-340" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-340">[340]</a></sup> In January 2013, Ronaldo became <a href="/wiki/Save_the_Children" title="Save the Children">Save the Children</a>'s new Global Artist Ambassador, in which he hopes to help fight child hunger and obesity.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-341">[341]</a></sup> In March 2013, Ronaldo agreed to be the ambassador for The Mangrove Care Forum in Indonesia. The forum aims to raise awareness to the Indonesian and international community of the importance of conserving biodiversity and ecosystem of mangroves in the South Bay of Benoa, Bali.<sup id="cite_ref-342" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-342">[342]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wealth">Wealth</span></h3>
<p>In March 2010, <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i> ranked Ronaldo third in its list of the world's highest paid footballers, behind <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, with £27&#160;million (€29.2&#160;million) in combined income from salaries, bonuses and off-field earnings.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-343">[343]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-344" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-344">[344]</a></sup> His net wealth is estimated at $160&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-345" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-345">[345]</a></sup>
</p><p>In January 2014, Spain's high tax laws meant that, reportedly the world's highest-paid player in terms of gross salary, Ronaldo (£11.87 millon-a-year) could only rank second in terms of net pay in <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=World_Soccer_Magazine&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="World Soccer Magazine (page does not exist)">World Soccer Magazine</a>'</i>s list of the footballers with the highest salary, focusing on net basic salaries and do not include bonuses and incentives.<sup id="cite_ref-346" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-346">[346]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sponsorships">Sponsorships</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo has signed many sponsorships as his reputation rapidly grew from his time at <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-347" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-347">[347]</a></sup> In October 2009, Ronaldo was named the new spokesmodel for <a href="/wiki/Emporio_Armani" title="Emporio Armani" class="mw-redirect">Emporio Armani</a> men's underwear and jeans.<sup id="cite_ref-348" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-348">[348]</a></sup> In February 2010, he re-upped his endorsement contract with American sportswear company <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nike,_Inc.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nike, Inc. (page does not exist)">Nike</a> until 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-newNikedeal_349-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-newNikedeal-349">[349]</a></sup> He has also signed other sponsorships from <a href="/wiki/Coca-Cola" title="Coca-Cola">Coca-Cola</a>, <a href="/wiki/Castrol" title="Castrol">Castrol</a>, <a href="/wiki/Konami" title="Konami">Konami</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Banco_Espirito_Santo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Banco Espirito Santo (page does not exist)">Banco Espirito Santo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Motorola" title="Motorola">Motorola</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jacob_Arabo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jacob Arabo (page does not exist)">Jacob &amp; Co.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Herbalife" title="Herbalife">Herbalife</a> and <a href="/wiki/KFC" title="KFC">KFC</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-350" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-350">[350]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-351" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-351">[351]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-352" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-352">[352]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-353">[353]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354">[354]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-355" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-355">[355]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-356" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-356">[356]</a></sup> All of his sponsorships have earned him a total of an estimated $21&#160;million per year as of June 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-357" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-357">[357]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Fashion">Fashion</span></h3>
<p>In 2006, Ronaldo opened a fashion boutique under the name "CR7" (his initials and shirt number) on the island of <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>, Portugal. Ronaldo expanded his business with a second clothes boutique in <a href="/wiki/Lisbon" title="Lisbon">Lisbon</a> in 2008. The stores include diamond-studded belts, jeans with leather pockets and patented buckled loafers. The store also sells slinky outfits for women.<sup id="cite_ref-358" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-358">[358]</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2013, Ronaldo expanded his fashion line. In partnership with Danish company JBS Textile Group, Ronaldo designed his own underwear line.<sup id="cite_ref-359" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-359">[359]</a></sup> The line named CR7 was unveiled at the <a href="/wiki/Plaza_de_Cibeles" title="Plaza de Cibeles">Palacio de Cibeles</a> in Madrid on 31 October 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-360" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-360">[360]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Media">Media</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo's autobiography, titled <i>Moments</i>, was published in December 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-chapters.indigo_361-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-chapters.indigo-361">[361]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 9 June 2010, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Madame_Tussauds_London&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Madame Tussauds London (page does not exist)">Madame Tussauds London</a> unveiled Ronaldo's waxwork as part of the build-up to the World Cup. Ronaldo joined fellow footballers <a href="/wiki/Steven_Gerrard" title="Steven Gerrard">Steven Gerrard</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a> at the event's venue.<sup id="cite_ref-362" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-362">[362]</a></sup> Ronaldo is sponsored by the U.S. sportswear company <a href="/w/index.php?title=Nike,_Inc.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nike, Inc. (page does not exist)">Nike</a> and features in their television advertisements.<sup id="cite_ref-363" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-363">[363]</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was featured on the front cover of the video games <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=FIFA_Street_2&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="FIFA Street 2 (page does not exist)">FIFA Street 2</a></i> and <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2008&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2008 (page does not exist)">Pro Evolution Soccer 2008</a></i>.
